boids.utils

Class Vector2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • boids.utils.Vector2D

  • public class Vector2D
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a 2D Vector. This class may have many applications: location, velocity, acceleration, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Vector2D other)
        Add the elements of another vector to this one. If the other vector is null, this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        other - The other 2D vector.

      • minus

        public void minus(Vector2D other)
        Subtract the elements of another vector to this one. If the other vector is null, this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        other - The other 2D vector.

      • minus

        public static Vector2D minus(Vector2D v1,
                             Vector2D v2)
        Substract two vectors (v1 - v2) and return the result. If one of the vectors is null, this static method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        v1 - The first vector.
        v2 - The second vector.
        Returns:
        The result of v1 - v2.

      • divideBy

        public void divideBy(double factor)
        Divide the vector. If the factor is zero, the division is impossible!
        Parameters:
        factor - The factor to divide the vector with.

      • multiplyBy

        public void multiplyBy(double factor)
        Multiply the vector.
        Parameters:
        factor - The factor to multiply the vector with.

      • angle

        public double angle()
        Compute the angle a vector has to the horizontal.
        Returns:
        The angle to horizontal

      • distanceWith

        public double distanceWith(Vector2D other)
        Compute the Euclidean distance between this vector and another one. If the other vector is null, +oo is returned.
        Parameters:
        other - The other vector.
        Returns:
        The Euclidean distance between two Vector2D.

      • magnitude

        public double magnitude()
        Compute the magnitude of the Vector2D.
        Returns:
        The magnitude.
